de.systemagmbh.tools.table
Class CSysTableDataReader

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.table.CSysTableDataReader
public class CSysTableDataReader
extends Object

Class for reading data that has the structure of a table from a file and returning a table object. The columns and the column data types can be configured as the separator that is used in the file.

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $
Author:
Rüdiger Breit, Frank Weber, Herbert Helmstreit, Frank Thomas, Udo Friedrich

Constructor Detail

CSysTableDataReader

public CSysTableDataReader(ISysConfigItem configItem)
                    throws CSysConfigException,
                           CSysTableException,
                           ClassNotFoundException
Initilaize a new TableDataReader instance and read its configuration from a given config file.

Parameters:
configItem - The configuration Item The following configuration items are mandatory:
  • "Delimiter" (Can be more than one character! E.g. ';;' That is ';' will not be seen as a separator.)
  • "ColumnConfiguration"
      The item "ColumnConfiguration" must contain the column definitions in a way that the parameter names are the column names and the parameter values are the column class types. These class types must be supported by the used table (ISysTable) implementation. E.g. java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.lang.Float, java.lang.Double. The package name is mandatory.
      Throws:
      CSysConfigException - if one of the items cannot be found.
      CSysTableException - if the table can not be created.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the configured table column classes can not be loaded.

Read a file and return the file contents in ISysTable object.

Returns:
A table with the content of the file.
Throws:
IOException - if the given file can not be read.
ParseException - if the given file can not be parsed.

createTableCopy

protected ISysTable createTableCopy()
Create a copy of the template table that contains the same column and column class definition as the template table. It has no rows.

the copy of the template table.
